reviews.text:
Loads of planes and helicopters, all really cool. 

Interesting, informative, thought provoking. Focuses on the human side of war in the air as much as the technology. All the better for it.

Currently on display is a collection of art created by students at a local school. Some real talent there.

Cafe, gift shop, plenty of parking, excellent accessibility for less able folk. Easy to find and plenty of parking. Look for the plane by the Mobil petrol station.

Excellent place to visit building is beautifully done spent 3hrs. The tour was informative and fun. Cafe was clean with excellent food. Gift shop had good quality stuff. Will definitely go back when in Christchurch again best place I've been couldn't fault it right done to all the staff. My 16yr old son raved about it.

The museum has historic airplanes in a very good restored condition.
It has a lot of space to walk and sit around, it's very clean including its bathrooms.
The staff is very kind and friendly and they have free tours during the day and the access to the museum is free of charge. Very impressive. We were very glad to luckily have stopped by.

Visit the Air Force Museum it is worth it.  The military aircraft on display are impressive.  Full size aircraft such as a Dakota DC3 and a Spitfire.

The facilities can be hired and significantly sized functions can be held onsite. 

There is a cafeteria and restrooms as well as plenty of car parks usually always available.

The Air Force Museum is a definite go and see place if you haven't been there.

First class museum made sure this was top of my list of places to visit during my time in Christchurch. Not disappointed, be sure to take the tour, guides are great and you get to see behind the scenes, great little cafe and very friendly staff.

Recovery is going well, more and more things are opening and the collection of shops is beautifully curated. Great toilets too! Try an ice cream at Rollicking (they also do dairy free) or fudge samples at the Fudge Cottage.
Great place to explore. Only partially open due to on going earthquake repairs. Centrally located new the museum and botanical gardens.

Saw the art centre for the first time since it was fixed up, it was really beautiful and really well done up. The buildings had cafes and exhibits and some nice craft themed shops. We enjoyed looking around the ancient Greek exhibition, it was a creative, informative and interesting display of pots and artifacts.
Simply beautiful and serene place. Glad it is being restored a valuable asset for Christchurch.

Sad to see a scale down a bit.
Atmosphere also less festive with fewer local tourists. 

Hope that the city cheer up a bit the next time we visit and not lost the charm.

Fantastic museum with so many rooms we were in there for hours . There was fascinating local history as well as a display on Antarctica. It was free but we felt it deserved giving a small donation. A stroll through the gardens after was divine.

This is a must see if you visit the city. If you want an interactive museum that the entire family can enjoy, this is it. The recent history section will have you engulfed for at least an hour. There are no limits to the education you can obtain from this site. You have to see it and experience it to understand. Do not miss this when passing through.

The museum is next to the botanical gardens. Admission is free and they have nice bathrooms. The exhibits are very well done. The short videos explain a lot such as how axes were made from greenstone. We recommend this museum if you are in Christchurch.

Enjoyed this museum and offered a place to pass the time for a few hours.  Lots of good information related to history and she.  I love that this is free to the public - very impressive and a great public service.

My family enjoyed their visit here. thanks Not a large museum but packed in a lot. Some exhibits seemed older but still interesting if you have not visited before. We stayed most of the morning which shows that they were able to hold the interest of young children for some time. They particularly liked the explorer zone but it is $2 admission price. Worth a visit in Christchurch and what wouldn't you as it is free entry ( donations encouraged)

Awesome place! What a great way to spend a lovely Sunday. It's such a great sight to see everything oldie in this place - brings you back to the time when life was much simpler and carefree. Loved seeing the old printer models, old telephones, old house interiors and even an old vacuum cleaner! The tram the traverses through the heritage park accentuated the old school feel of the place and highly recommend to take the tram ride as well. The visit here was truly worth it!

Went on a Monday so a little quiet.  Didn't feel the bustle of the last visits.  Still stayed 2 hours, quaint ,tram ride excellent and my 8 year old didn't want to leave. Great education for children and rich history for adults.
Attended a wedding here, beautiful place for a wedding! Timeless location, nice to visit, friendly staff, beautiful trees and nature. Like stepping back in time. Highly recommend
Excellent place for family. The printer and telephone exchange in the post office are must see, awesome precision machinery at its best!
Beside the heritage ferrymead park is an easy walking track. It winds along the tidal estuary, the home to a selection if wetland birds. Peaceful.

Was great to see a wonderful center which was aimed at a wide sector of the community. Both the adults and the children enjoyed the visit. As locals I would certainly recommend this place to other visitors.

"Great place to kill a few hours prior to flying out" will be most people's reason to visit and it is, but so much more as well. It is a great attraction that stands by itself as a place to see whist in town. It just happens to be by an airport as well!
Very interesting with we informed staff. Great experiences such as the blizzard room where you get to see what it is like first hand. Worth a look.

The International Antarctic Centre is is excellent. You can ride in an Over-snow vehicle, see and pat Husky dogs ,get up close to Little Blue Penguins ,see films about the Antarctic and get to experience what it is like in a Blizzard. We recommend a visit to this place.

We were a group of 8 people from 4 different countries. We are all sailors interested in adventure and in learning about Antarctica. The Antarctic experience exceeded our expectations with all of the interactive components. The amount of information on scientific research, weather, geology, history, th e international treaty and the living creatures is extensive and well curated. We were pleased to discover that the few penguins were rescue penguins that would not survive if released as opposed to healthy specimens on display like a zoo. Definitely worth the cost of the ticket and the time

The museum was wonderful but had one glaring omission: where was the representation of the 70 ESL students who lost their lives? It felt a VERY white-washed experience apart from one photo of the Japanese rescuer.  This really needs to be addressed. I was really surprised to not see or hear any of their stories or from their families. Please correct this as it really takes away from the experience.

This museum was very interesting and informative. We brought our 2 kids here with their cousins and spent about 2 hours in there which is about the max if you don't sit down and watch all the interviews. The museum could have more hands on exhibits for kids to understand earthquakes and building structures. Though the liquifaction exhibit was very intriguing.
Moving and informative. Lovely staff and somewhere you can store luggage for free while you go round too. Easy to spend 3 hours here.

Very informative. I think there was a great history, human connection, bravery and hope to rebuild.
I would spend a good hour there. Entrance fee would  help rebuild the city. Definitely recommend

Wow! An eye opening experience that really shows you the resilience of the community in Christchurch. Very educational. 

Give yourself at least 1.5hrs to see everything here.

The liquefaction simulator was my favorite. I did not understand the process until I saw this display.

We loved the man working at the cash register when we arrived - he was halirious!

Wonderful wild life resort with a beautiful and diverse amount of different animals! There is a kiwi-watching guarantee, which is easily hold because there is a nocturnal as well as a normal daylight area with several kiwis. The birds in the nocturnal area are not shy at all and can be observed easily. Another highlight are the tamed eels, which you can feed with a spoon. The resort animal keepers are really nice and helpful.

This is a fantastic family venue. I highly recommend a visit with your young families to this wonderful wildlife park. There are numerous enclosures hosting both native and exotic animals. There is an abundance of farmyard animals and tamed birds that allow hand feeding from start to finish. Clean toilets, lunchtime picknick facilities and the entire park is stroller/pram friendly. 10/10 would visit again.

A very interesting place to visit. We saw 4 kiwi, 3 of which came very close to us. The natural setting was enjoyable to walk through with lots of cool looking critters to see. We had a delicious lunch the cafe. I highly recommend visiting the Willowbank Wildlife Reserve.

This is such a wonderful place for a family to go and explore and even feed the animals. Tame eels, were a highlight!! Feeding them and hearing their teeth scrapping on the spoon was amazing. My son had a pony ride and the smile on his face I will remember forever. As he has autism it is very rare to see him so full if joy. Great day. Happy family that will be going again. Yay!!!

A fun place to spend the afternoon. The only place I've ever seen take eels that you can feed. 
The highlight was the nocturnal kiwi house, not as amazing as seeing them in the while but still wonderful to watch. 
We got a good deal on bookme so we bought a couple of bags feed with the saving and that was really fun.

Recovery is going well, more and more things are opening and the collection of shops is beautifully curated. Great toilets too! Try an ice cream at Rollicking (they also do dairy free) or fudge samples at the Fudge Cottage.
Great place to explore. Only partially open due to on going earthquake repairs. Centrally located new the museum and botanical gardens.

Saw the art centre for the first time since it was fixed up, it was really beautiful and really well done up. The buildings had cafes and exhibits and some nice craft themed shops. We enjoyed looking around the ancient Greek exhibition, it was a creative, informative and interesting display of pots and artifacts.
Simply beautiful and serene place. Glad it is being restored a valuable asset for Christchurch.

Sad to see a scale down a bit.
Atmosphere also less festive with fewer local tourists. 

Hope that the city cheer up a bit the next time we visit and not lost the charm.

The spa is very well kept. Large rooms, quiet and clean. It's always relaxing as soon as you pass the door. 
There is a pleasant smell, the staff is friendly.

They offer a wide variety of services for women and men. Including waxing for men.
Amazing. Booked the the palms spa experience. Very professional and very clean. The balinese massage was super relieving of body pains.
Excellent awesome service very professional  service 5 star experience wish they give more advertisement must visit
Fantastic ambience, great staff! You can get some good deals on nearbuy and enjoy a couple of hours here.
Beautiful ambience and though they say 30 minutes, they actually go beyond the time mentioned and ensure a good service. They basically do their job very well. Must try

Fantastic food, delicious and wholesome.
Great customer service too. We felt cosy and comfy.
Really tasty breakfast and the lady serving us was very friendly and kind! Would come again.
Always yum food and good coffee, convenient for us Ara students
This is a basic kiwi Cafe or Diner. Cheap eats and friendly service. Nothing fancy here but good wholesome food and great prices. Great for those on a budget. Toilets available.
Not a bad place for lunch

This is easily my favourite cafe in the city. The coffee is excellent,  the cheese scones are probably the best in Christchurch and there are seats for all weather
 There is a beautifully landscaped garden for warm weather and a gas fire for cold. 
Normally service is prompt but there are occasional busy times when the wait can be long ( last time was 30 minutes). Staff are all very friendly.
Stopped by for afternoon tea with family. Nice coffee and cake. Great service. Lovely outdoor garden area really nice place to sit.
Great food. All 4 of us very happy with our meals. Coffee a bit slow to arrive but waitress apologised it was taking so long and it arrived soon after so they were proactive with us mentioning it.

Really beautiful place. Doesn't feel like your on Riccarton road. The food is lovely too. Good flavours but to be honest the garlic bread was the best! It actually has loads of garlic and tastes amazing. Best in NZ!

Very nice location and friendly staff.

It would have been helpful to know that we need to pay at the register since I kept waiting for someone to give me my bill.

They close for dinner about an hour ahead of their published closing times so plan accordingly.

I had their deconstructed pavlova for dessert (they only serve desserts for food the last hour before closing). I personally was not a big fan since it was mostly just meringue - I had pavlova at Te Puia in Rotorua and enjoyed that significantly better.

First of all my breakfast was underwhelming. Only 1 egg, hummus tasted like it was out of a container not fresh and the relish was too much wet. Avocado was extremely nice and fresh though. My mimosa I requested fresh fruit garnish and got nothing. My friends cider which is supposed to be a pint came in a Catalina glass which is certainly not the same volume as a pint! Waiter was good and attentive as well. 2 stars.

The main was delicious, I had the vegetarian green risotto. The dessert was amazing. I have good memories of the desserts from when I was young so it did not disappoint. It was a simple designed restaurant but spacious.
Very friendly staff, pricey but good food. No dessert cos too expensive. Recommended for special occasions
Great range of dessert. I had the Frozen coconut sorbet. It was yummy. Great service.

best place for desserts!! their menu is pretty expensive, never ate from their dinner menu but the dessert menu is definitely worth the money!! not a dessert person but these really are pretty good — would recommend the torte and anything chocolatey!!

Honestly, this place is top notch. Everytime I have been in to eat here, I have been greeted with EXCEPTIONAL customer service and EXCEPTIONAL food with the freshest of ingredients. 

The consistency and overall service has never let me down, I do recommend eating here when you get the chance.
Love this place, awesome staff and delicious food. Never had an issue here. Except the sauce bottles might want to be wiped down frequently as they are a bit sticky 😭

Excellent burger - as usual: quick service, yummy burger, good music! Make sure you get the kumara fries aside as they're SO delicious!!! I had the Veg8 (vegan burger) and loved it. Was a big burger with a crunchy 'beef', crispy lettuce, 'cheese', etc. All good!
Delicious, inexpensive burgers at a convenient location. Staff are ways very nice and friendly. Burgers come out pretty fast unless you go on a Tuesday evening, where they do 2 for 1 deals.
A great place to have a outing. Has high quality food. Great staff.

It was Monday night but still very busy. Table booked for several people. Food for sharing was incredible. Something for everyone from fish to pork .Beef and gluten free. Probably not the best for a vegetarian but you would find something you liked for sure.Drinks took a little while coming but the overall ambiance was 4.50 stars.
Great cocktails and food. Fabulous service. Warm, welcoming and totally not up itself 😚

I visited King of Snake with work colleagues and was blown away by the quality of the food and service. We shared a range of plates coupled with some local NZ project pilsners and each of them was absolutely delicious. If I had to nominate, the Sticky Beef Wontons, Fried Rice Balls and the Pumpkin Curry were the standouts at the table but seriously there was not a bad dish delivered. The atmosphere is fantastic and the staff all incredibly friendly. Well worth the visit when next you’re in Christchurch.
Food was excellent, service was great. Vegetarian and vegan friendly. Definitely recommend!

This place is brilliant. The food is fantastic and the service was second to none. Big shout out to Katrina who was very patient in booking my group in - it was a reunion of sorts and was an exercise in herding cats and so I had to change numbers a few times. And also to Arno (hope I spelt that correctly) who looked after us on the night. Definitely coming back here - highly recommended.
